decks.notes: This deck focuses on early game disruption with Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, followed by efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy to control the board. Tarmogoyf and Grim Flayer provide powerful threats that can quickly close out the game. The deck also includes cards like Scavenging Ooze and Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet to gain value from creatures in the graveyard. Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope offer additional disruption and card advantage, while cards like Hissing Quagmire and Treetop Village provide creature lands for extra beats.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the synergy between Death's Shadow and various cards that enable you to lower your own life total quickly, such as Street Wraith and Mishra's Bauble. By strategically managing your life total and using disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial, you aim to control the pace of the game while quickly closing it out with a massive Death's Shadow or Gurmag Angler. The inclusion of tempo cards like Snapcaster Mage and removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt provide additional versatility and control options.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with low-cost, aggressive creatures such as Goblin Guide, Monastery Swiftspear, and Bomat Courier, while also dealing direct damage through spells like Searing Blaze, Skewer the Critics, Rift Bolt, Lava Spike, and Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to apply pressure early on and finish the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize, utilizing cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Atarka's Command to further punish opponents for casting spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate mana efficiently, allowing for explosive plays with Primeval Titan to tutor for powerful lands like Vesuva and Tolaria West. The deck also utilizes Hive Mind to force opponents to copy the spells it casts, and Pact spells to combo off and win the game in a single turn. The inclusion of Azusa, Lost but Seeking helps to ramp up mana production even further, enabling the deck to quickly assemble its key pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful combos.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This enables the player to cast powerful control cards such as Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to deal with threats and establish board control. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Wurmcoil Engine and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger to quickly close out the game once control has been established. The deck utilizes efficient card filtering and tutoring abilities to ensure consistency in assembling the Tron lands and key threats.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of artifact cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Chalice of the Void. The deck utilizes cards like Whir of Invention and Ancient Stirrings to tutor for key pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing a combination of artifact mana sources and lock pieces, the deck aims to stall the game until it can assemble a win condition. Additionally, cards like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt provide versatility and disruption against various strategies. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent through strategic control elements.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw until it can stabilize the board with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. Terminus provides a board wipe option, while Celestial Colonnade offers a win condition. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and out-value them in the long run, using efficient spells and lands like Field of Ruin to keep them in check. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around maintaining control of the game and eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Death's Shadow to quickly reduce the opponent's life total while also utilizing pump spells like Temur Battle Rage and Become Immense to deal massive damage. With Thoughtseize for disruption and Mishra's Bauble for card advantage, the deck aims to win the game swiftly before the opponent can set up their own game plan. The mana base is optimized to support the aggressive strategy and allow for consistent casting of spells.

The main idea of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy using various artifacts and spells. The deck focuses on setting up a lock with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Witchbane Orb while generating value through the Thopter Foundry/Sword of the Meek combo. The deck also has ways to tutor for specific answers with cards like Whir of Invention and Search for Azcanta. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind out a win through resource denial and incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing Amulet of Vigor to generate explosive mana ramp with cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Primeval Titan. The goal is to quickly assemble the Amulet Titan combo, allowing for powerful plays such as bouncing lands with bounce lands like Selesnya Sanctuary and Simic Growth Chamber to generate mana and search for key lands with Primeval Titan. Pact of Negation provides protection while Engineered Explosives helps control the board. Walking Ballista can be a win condition, while other utility lands and spells provide additional support for the combo strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with Dredge cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, in order to bring back powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast. By utilizing cards like Life from the Loam and Creeping Chill, the deck can consistently grind out value and deal damage to the opponent. The goal is to create a looping engine of creatures coming back from the graveyard and overwhelming the opponent with a steady stream of threats. The deck is designed to be explosive and resilient, capable of winning games through its graveyard synergy.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy utilizing a variety of Human creatures. By leveraging cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence. Cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage help disrupt the opponent's game plan while Aether Vial allows for quick creature deployment. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to maximize efficiency and ensure consistent access to colored mana for the diverse range of creatures included in the deck.
